neighbors.name: Stephen L. Frushon
neighbors.claims: Stephen L. Frushon is a private landowner and resident of Baltimore County, Maryland [National Public Data](https://nationalpublicdata.com/people/f/stephen-frushon/). While he has no documented history of intervening in land use or development hearings, he has demonstrated support for local institutions, appearing as a donor to the University of Maryland Baltimore County (UMBC) Albin O. Kuhn Library & Gallery in 2011 [UMBC Friends of the Library Newsletter](https://library.umbc.edu/friends/publications/Friends_of_the_Library_Newsletter2012.pdf). His stance on renewable energy development remains undocumented in public news and meeting records.
neighbors.influence_justification: Private citizen with no identified leadership roles

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach as a private resident with potential ties to the local university community. Focus on maintaining the quiet enjoyment of his property, as he has no public track record of activism.

citations.claim: Stephen L. Frushon is a private landowner and resident of Baltimore County, Maryland
citations.title: Stephen L Frushon - National Public Data

citations.claim: Appearing as a donor to the University of Maryland Baltimore County (UMBC) Albin O. Kuhn Library & Gallery in 2011
citations.title: Friends of the Library & Gallery Newsletter

neighbors.name: Edward Heise
neighbors.claims: Edward Heise is a property owner in Baltimore County and has been identified in local media as a "native Arbutuan" (native of Arbutus, MD) [Patch Arbutus](https://patch.com/maryland/arbutus/heisters-grill-opens-in-arbutus). He is the husband of Leslie Heise, the proprietor of Heister's Grill in Arbutus, establishing him as part of a local business family [Patch Arbutus](https://patch.com/maryland/arbutus/heisters-grill-opens-in-arbutus). Additionally, an Edward Heise is listed as the principal officer for Relief Resources Inc., a non-profit organization based in Halethorpe, MD [ProPublica Nonprofit Explorer](https://projects.propublica.org/nonprofits/organizations/521769222/202502889349302615/full). Despite his long-standing residency and business connections, he has not publicly taken a stance on solar or development projects in county hearings.
neighbors.influence_justification: Local business family connection; no political office found

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage with respect for his status as a lifelong resident ('native Arbutuan') and local business stakeholder. Frame the project as compatible with the long-term economic health of the community he has invested in.

citations.claim: Identified in local media as a 'native Arbutuan' and husband of Heister's Grill proprietor
citations.title: Heister's Grill Opens in Arbutus

citations.claim: Listed as principal officer for Relief Resources Inc. in Halethorpe, MD
citations.title: Relief Resources Inc - Full Filing - Nonprofit Explorer

neighbors.name: State Of Maryland State Roads Commission
neighbors.claims: The State Roads Commission (part of the Maryland Department of Transportation/MDOT) actively supports renewable energy development on its properties. MDOT established a 'Renewable Energy Master Contract' approved by the Board of Public Works in 2018 to install solar photovoltaic systems on state-owned rights-of-way and facilities [MDOT Solar Program](https://www.mdot.maryland.gov/tso/pages/Index.aspx?PageId=155). The agency views these projects as opportunities to generate revenue through land leases and meet state greenhouse gas reduction goals, having identified over 800 facilities for potential PV system development [FHWA Value Capture](https://www.fhwa.dot.gov/ipd/value_capture/strategies_in_practice/maryland_solar_program.aspx). They have previously solicited master contractors to develop solar projects with no capital investment required from the state [FHWA Value Capture](https://www.fhwa.dot.gov/ipd/value_capture/strategies_in_practice/maryland_solar_program.aspx).
neighbors.influence_justification: State agency with regulatory authority over ROW

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach via MDOT's existing Office of Environment or Real Estate. Reference their Renewable Energy Master Contract and propose alignment with their GHG reduction goals (40% by 2030).

citations.claim: Established a Renewable Energy Master Contract to install solar on rights-of-way
citations.title: MDOT Solar Energy Contract

citations.claim: Identified over 800 facilities for potential PV development to meet GHG goals
citations.title: Maryland Solar Program: Value Capture
